page.title: 12Educational Visits
page.content: Educational visits are arranged to theatres in Sheffield,Rotherham and Doncaster, to watch plays, pantomimes, ballet and musicals. Museums visited include the Jorvik Viking Centre, York and Beamish, Co. Durham.Local visits include Conisbrough Castle, Roche Abbey, Cusworth Hall, Doncaster Mansion House, Doncaster Market, Leverton Windmill, Magpie Wood, a Limestone Quarry and Denaby Ings Nature Reserve.North Derbyshire villages are another source of interest. A five day School Journey each year is spent at Scargill House, Kettlewell, North Yorkshire. Activities include fell walking, pot holing, church and village studies, with visits to a farm, trout farm, museum and Bolton Priory. Together with Tickhill Estfeld School, annual visits are made to Normandy, France.
